argumentText:
ARGUMENT

| Step | Hyp | Ref | Expression |
|---|---|---|---|

| 1 |  | equs45f.1 | |- ( ph -> A. y ph ) |
| 2 | 1 | #P_anim2i | |- ( ( x = y /\ ph ) -> ( x = y /\ A. y ph ) ) |
| 3 | 2 | #P_eximi | |- ( E. x ( x = y /\ ph ) -> E. x ( x = y /\ A. y ph ) ) |
| 4 |  | #P_equs5a | |- ( E. x ( x = y /\ A. y ph ) -> A. x ( x = y -> ph ) ) |
| 5 | 3, 4 | #P_syl | |- ( E. x ( x = y /\ ph ) -> A. x ( x = y -> ph ) ) |
| 6 |  | #P_equs4 | |- ( A. x ( x = y -> ph ) -> E. x ( x = y /\ ph ) ) |
| 7 | 5, 6 | #P_impbii | |- ( E. x ( x = y /\ ph ) <-> A. x ( x = y -> ph ) ) |
\
 Two ways of expressing substitution when ` y ` is not free in ` ph ` . (Contributed by NM, 25-Apr-2008.)
